verse:
तं प्रश्रयेणावनता: सुसत्कृतं सव्रीडहासेक्षणसूनृतादिभि: ।
रहस्यपृच्छन्नुपविष्टमासने विज्ञाय सन्देशहरं रमापते: ॥

terms.ramā-pateḥ: of the master of the goddess of fortune.

vedabase.translation: Bowing their heads in humility, the gopīs duly honored Uddhava with their shy, smiling glances and pleasing words. They took him to a quiet place, seated him comfortably and began to question him, for they recognized him to be a messenger from Kṛṣṇa, the master of the goddess of fortune.
vedabase.purport: The chaste gopīs were enlivened to see that a messenger had come from Kṛṣṇa. As Uddhava will discover during his stay in Vṛndāvana, the unique gopīs could not think of anything but their beloved Kṛṣṇa.

terms.सन्देशहरं: the one who bears the message

gpt.meaning: O Lord of Rama (Sri Krishna), knowing that you have the message, those who are well attentive, bowed down in reverence, and seated nearby secretly inquire about it while exchanging mischievous smiles and glances, some being honest and others being deceitful.

terms.tam praśrayeṇa avanatāḥ su sat-kṛtam sa-: They bowed down to him with inquiries, smiles, glances, good-naturedness etc., and asked him privately, knowing that he was the bringer of the message from Rāma.
